- Universal Children’s Day— November 20   
-National Child Safety and Protection Month– November
about_extra: I would love help setting up a landing page on my website and on Marble press for pre-orders. People who pre-order can qualify for a free gift ( access to an online webinar that can be recorded or free access to my body safety kids class) Dr. Becky ( from the parenting book Good Inside) has a great book launches pre-order sit
author_long_bio:
Kimberly King is a best-selling author, child safety expert, and leading voice in body safety education. With over 250,000 books sold, her research-based, kid-friendly books—including I Said No! A Kid-to-Kid Guide to Keeping Private Parts Private—help parents, educators, and caregivers protect children from abuse. Her work is recommended by the Child Mind Institute, Harvard Graduate School of Education, and the Journal of Child Sexual Abuse for its accessible and empowering approach.   

As a notable speaker at National Education for Young Children and Johns Hopkins School of Public Health, Kimberly provides expert training for schools, organizations, and conferences. She offers online classes, private consultations, and body safety workshops for families and educators, making prevention strategies easy and actionable. Her latest book, Body Safety for Young Children: Empowering Caring Adults, serves as a practical guide for parents and teachers.   

Kimberly’s expertise has been featured on ABC News The Motherside, Child Mind Institute, and cited in academic research. She actively volunteers with Saprea.org, supporting survivors and raising awareness about child abuse prevention. With a background in education and decades of experience, she is committed to helping families have age-appropriate, empowering conversations about safety and boundaries.   

Whether through her books, online courses, or speaking engagements, Kimberly equips parents and professionals with the tools they need to prevent child sexual abuse before it happens. Learn more at www.kimberlykingbooks.com 

and follow @ToughTopicsMom on social media.

title: Imagining Elsewhere
author: Sara Hosey
author_bio:
Queens native Sara Hosey is the author of a novel, Iphigenia Murphy, and a novella, Great Expectations, as well as short fiction appearing in publications including Cordella Magazine and Casino Literary. Sara has also written an academic book about popular culture: Home is Where the Hurt Is: Media Depictions of Wives and Mothers.


Sara has held many jobs—she’s been a nanny, a home health aide, a chaperone for exchange students visiting the United States, a relay operator for the hearing impaired, and a security guard at the US Open in Flushing. She has worked in retail and in restaurants, in theaters and on screen as an extra in an educational film. These days, however, she mainly teaches English at a community college and writes. When she’s not working, she likes to spend time with her family and pets in upstate New York.
about_summary: It's 1988 and former bully, Astrid, arrives in Elsewhere with plans to reinvent herself. That is, until she meets Candi, the teenage tyrant with supernatural powers who rules the town. Astrid begins to dig into the history of Elsewhere and the source of Candi’s powers. Pooling their resources, the friends develop a plan to resist Candi’s compulsion and to escape Elsewhere.

title: Inevitable Fate
author: Lindsay K. Bandy
author_bio: Lindsay K. Bandy writes historical and speculative fiction for teens and adults, as well as poetry for young children. In addition to working at a high school library, she runs an award-winning public library-based magazine program for teens and serves as the published member coordinator for the Eastern PA chapter of SCBWI. Her first novel, Nemesis and the Swan, was described by Booklist as an “intrigue-soaked work of historical fiction (that) feels entirely of the past and yet also incredibly relevant,” and was the recipient of an AudioFile Magazine Earphones award. In addition to books, Lindsay has a soft spot for donuts, ghost tours, and power sanding. She can often be found rescuing old furniture from curbs in Lancaster, Pennsylvania, where she lives with her husband, two daughters, and two cats.
about_summary: When a seventeen-year-old art student falls in love with a mysteriously familiar girl, he realizes she’s about to die. Again. If he can’t put the pieces of their past together in time to change her fate, he’ll lose her—and himself—forever.

title: Infinity Drive
author: Ross Richdale
author_bio:
After a career as a teacher and principal of mainly small rural schools, Ross Richdale lives in the university town of Palmerston North in the North Island of New Zealand. There he writes contemporary novels and science fiction. He is married with three adult children and six grandchildren.

His interest in current events and international incidents serve as a backdrop for many of his novels. Ordinary people, rather than the super rich or super powerful, are the main characters in his stories. His plots reflect his interest in the rural lifestyle as well as the cross section of personalities he’s met as a teacher.
about_summary: The humanz who rule Sympia are less than a meter eighty in height and consider anyone who exceeds this a felon, including Brittany Forbes. She and her friends escape but encounter threats on both their planet and in space. This group of runaways need to defeat their enemies to change their world.

title: Inheritance of Lies
author: Chrissy Hicks
author_bio: Chrissy Hicks is an award-winning author whose writing is featured in anthologies and ezines, including Story Sanctum, Black Works, Killer Nashville, and The Broadkill Review, among others. Her unpublished mystery and thriller novels have earned Top Pick and Suspense Finalist for the Claymore Award, as well as First Place in the Seven Hills Literary Contest and Thomas Mabry Creative Writing Award. Aside from thinking up ways for characters to die, she hikes, runs, reads, and drinks dark wine. She lives in Tennessee with her family. You can find her online at https://chrissyhicks.com.
about_summary: A young woman struggling with addiction and anxiety joins an investigation of her mother’s alleged murder-suicide, which orphaned her as a baby. She fears the answers she may find: either she is the daughter of a killer, or the murderer roams free. What she uncovers causes her to question everything she thought she knew.

title: Intergalactic Exterminators, Inc
author: Ash Bishop
author_bio: Ash Bishop is a lifetime reader who loves all genres, especially science fiction, mystery, and fantasy. He has been a high school English teacher, worked in the video game industry, and in educational app development. He even used to fetch coffee for Quentin Tarantino during the production of the film Jackie Brown. Many years ago, he earned an MFA in Creative Writing from San Diego State University. He currently works in veteran services, assisting members of the military transition into the civilian workforce but spends his best days at home in Southern California with his wife and two wonderful children.
about_summary: Russ Wesley finds a mysterious stone in his grandfather’s bookstore, not knowing it would attract a deadly alien predator. A team of Intergalactic Exterminators is dispatched to get rid of the pest and are impressed by Russ’s marksmanship, insisting he join their squad . . . whether he wants to or not.

title: Intergalactic Waste Management, LLC
author: Ash Bishop
author_bio: Ash Bishop is a lifetime reader who loves all genres, especially science fiction, mystery, and fantasy. He has been a high school English teacher, worked in the video game industry, and in educational app development. He even used to fetch coffee for Quentin Tarantino during the production of the film Jackie Brown. Many years ago, he earned an MFA in Creative Writing from San Diego State University. He currently works in veteran services, assisting members of the military transition into the civilian workforce but spends his best days at home in Southern California with his wife and two wonderful children.
about_summary: Former Intergalactic Exterminator Russ Wesley has found a new gig at Intergalactic Waste Management, LLC, in what promises to be a cushy job processing space debris. But when he finds a dead body stashed among the space wreckage, Russ's quest for the truth causes the murderer to turn their attention in his direction.

title: Into A Canyon Deep
author: James Lindholm
author_bio: Dr. James Lindholm dives deep for his inspiration. His novels are based on a foundation of direct, personal experience with the undersea world. He has lived underwater for multiple 10-day missions to the world’s only undersea laboratory and has even found himself alone on the seafloor staring into the eyes of a hungry female great white shark. Along with his ocean adventures, Lindholm has drafted text for an executive order for the White House and has briefed members of the House and Senate on issues of marine science and policy. He works as the Chair of the Department of Marine Science at California State University, Monterey Bay. James Lindholm’s diverse writing portfolio includes textbooks, peer-reviewed scientific journal articles, and the Chris Black series of action/adventure novels.
about_summary: Returning from a research dive off the coast of picturesque Carmel-by-the-Sea, Chris Black receives threats telling him in no uncertain terms to stop diving deep. What is it that he might have seen on the ocean floor? And what is the connection to those who exude influence over Chris Black’s research projects by funding them?

title: Into the Deep Blue
author: Jennifer E. Archer
description:
Perfect for fans of Nicola Yoon’s The Sun is Also a Star and John Green’s The Fault in Our Stars,  Into the Deep Blue is Fiona and Nick’s achingly moving, wry, and hopeful tale about falling apart and coming together told from two unforgettable points of view, 

Nick and Fiona were meant to be friends—best friends—and they wouldn’t change that for the world. At least, that’s what they tell themselves. Because they can’t be an us. Nick doesn’t believe in happy endings ever since they both lost their moms unexpectedly senior year. And Fiona often wonders if all they have in common is their numb hearts. Still, they’re content to share everything else with each other. Honestly. Everything but sparks.  

But when Fiona accidentally lets her guard down more than she intended to with Nick, it threatens to ruin their fragile balancing act. Luckily, Nick isn’t about to let a little misunderstanding get in the way of the weekend trip they’ve been planning for months. Fiona is just hoping for some closure on the first anniversary of her mom’s death—except grief isn’t that simple, and choosing to love again isn’t, either. Now the only thing standing between Fiona and Nick is the truth. They just need the courage to reach for it. 

“Into the Deep Blue is YA contemporary at its best. Archer’s rich, complicated characters, spitfire pacing, and heartfelt interactions intertwine so effortlessly on every page. Nick and Fiona will steal your hearts in this layered expression of grief and hope, heartache and healing. A true gem.” —Laura Taylor Namey, New York Times bestselling author of A Cuban Girl’s Guide to Tea and Tomorrow
author_bio:
Jennifer E. Archer is an author and screenwriter based in Toronto. Her screenplay, Into the Deep Blue, won the Academy Nicholl Fellowships in Screenwriting and the hearts of many.  

When she’s not writing, she can be found hiding behind a book, re-watching Pride and Prejudice, or trying to find peace in nature—really trying. Into the Deep Blue is her first novel.  

Visit her online at jenniferarcherwrites.com or on Instagram @jennwrites
about_summary: (Jodi’s beautiful flap copy might help here? But here are some previous bits I had.) Short logline: Into the Deep Blue follows Nick and Fiona, best friends who met in group therapy, struggling to put the pieces of their lives together after loss. The last thing they need is to fall in love. When a weekend trip brings their deepening feelings to the surface they might sooner cut each other off than face them. Slightly longer one here: Nick Bennet is an expert at messing up. Maybe not as much as his older sister, but he really upped his game by getting a DUI, a license suspension, and mandatory grief counseling after their mom died. Now, he’s trying to put the pieces of his life together. He wants to get away from his family and go to college in New York to be a writer, but his dad is betting against him. Nick will mess up again—it’s what he does best. The last thing he needs is to fall in love with Fiona, his only friend from therapy. His only friend—period. With Fiona, he can be himself, darkly funny, lonely, a closet optimist, and more honest than he’s ever been in his life. Fiona gets it—this rollercoaster called grief—she’s stuck on it too. Fiona’s everything he’s not. She socializes in therapy, her gymnastics students adore her, and she has actual friends who care about her.
about_promotable_points: The screenplay for the book won the Academy Nicholl Fellowship.
A movie is being made! (Although reluctant to use the actors directly for promotion.)
about_diff_competitors: Dual POV
Guaranteed a happy ending!
Being made into a movie.
about_audience:
Teens-Adult 

 Fans of Summer I Turned Pretty, Maxton Hall, John Green,
about_dates_holidays: Filming dates are still being discussed. Some distributors want to wait for the book release, so we are still working on that.
author_long_bio:
Jennifer E. Archer is an author and screenwriter based in Toronto. Her screenplay, Into The Deep Blue, won the Academy Nicholl Fellowships in Screenwriting and the hearts of many.  

Jennifer writes stories rooted in reality with just a hint of magic because what’s life without a bit of magic? Her stories are always full of adventure, heartache, and hope.  

When she’s not writing, she can be found hiding behind a book, re-watching Pride and Prejudice, or trying to find peace in nature—really trying. Into The Deep Blue is her first novel.  

Visit her online at jenniferarcherwrites.com or on Instagram @jennwrites

title: Jester
author: Brielle D. Porter
author_bio: Brielle D. Porter decided to become a writer after a well-meaning elementary school teacher told her she had a gift for it. Stolen moments under the covers reading anything from Harry Potter to William Goldman solidified the desire to tell stories herself one day. Jester is her debut novel. Brielle lives with her husband and three sons on a lavender farm in Northern Idaho. When she’s not writing, she can be found running and beekeeping. Only ask her about her hobbies if you have plenty of time to spare.
about_summary: Lisette’s father killed the king. His execution leaves Lisette alone, disgraced, and without the magic he intended to pass on to her. Desperate to survive in a city glutted with power, Lisette enters into a deadly competition. If she wins, she’ll become the highest-ranked performer in the world—the Queen’s Jester. If she loses, it may be off with her head.

title: Jove Brand Is Near Death
author: J. A. Crawford
author_bio:
Despite what his family thinks, J. A. Crawford is not a spy and travels the country investigating disaster sites. Before that, he taught Criminal Justice, Montessori Kindergarten, and several martial arts. He divides his time between Michigan, California, and the worlds in his head.

Check in on J. A. Crawford at www.jacrawford.net.
about_summary: In this irreverent action-packed mystery a failed actor who once disastrously portrayed a famous fictional superspy is forced to go full method and play the part for real when he is framed for the murder of his celebrated successor.

title: Justice At Sea
author: Christian Klaver
author_bio: Christian Klaver has been writing for over twenty years, with a number of magazine publications, including Escape Pod, Dark Wisdom Anthology, and Anti-Matter. He’s the author of The Supernatural Case Files of Sherlock Holmes series, but has written over a dozen novels, both fantasy and sci-fi, often with a Noir bent. He's worked as book-seller, bartender and a martial-arts instructor before settling into a career in internet security. He lives just outside the sprawling decay of Detroit, Michigan, with his wife, Kimberly, his daughter, Kathryn, and a group of animals he refers to as The Menagerie. He’s also a part of the Untitled Writer’s Group based in Ann Arbor for the past decade or so with a bunch of equally starry-eyed dreamers and social misanthropes.
about_summary: Justice Kasric, her siblings, and her parents are locked in combat on both sides of the Human-Faerie War. Forced to make dangerous pacts with more than one unpredictable ally, only Justice can decide how far she’ll go to save London. Is it worth sacrificing even a member of her own family?

title: Karma of the Sun
author: Brandon Ying Kit Boey
author_bio: Brandon Ying Kit Boey is a novelist, poet, and lawyer living in Maine.
about_summary: A young Tibetan Sherpa hunts for his missing father in the ruined nuclear winterland of the Himalayas, racing against a final calamity that threatens to destroy what is left of all humanity, only to discover that his father’s disappearance may be linked to a mystical mountain connected to the afterworld—and a possible way to save their doomed future.

title: Kill Call
author: Jeff Wooten
author_bio: Jeff Wooten lives in Arkansas with his wife, three kids, and one dog. He is a physical therapist that works with adults and kids with orthopedic issues.
about_summary: A high school football player has recurring prophetic dreams of the murder of a hometown girl. He tries to help, only she ends up saving herself, and the killer gets away. Now, together, they must find the would-be killer before they strike again.

title: King Me
author: J. A. Crawford
author_bio:
Despite what his family thinks, J. A. Crawford is not a spy and travels the country investigating disaster sites. Before that, he taught Criminal Justice, Montessori Kindergarten, and several martial arts. He divides his time between Michigan, California, and the worlds in his head.

Check in on J. A. Crawford at www.jacrawford.net.
about_summary: D-list detective Ken Allen is called into action when the creator of an immensely popular fantasy television series is murdered, and his notebook—which contains all the secrets, twists, and endings—goes missing.

title: Ladies' Day
author: Lisa Williams Kline
author_bio: Ladies’ Day (CamCat Books 2023) is Lisa Williams Kline’s second novel for adults. Her first adult novel, Between the Sky and the Sea (Dragonblade) will be released in 2023. She is the author of a short story collection called Take Me (Main Street Rag), an essay collection called The Ruby Mirror (The Bridge) and ten novels for young readers. Her work has appeared in Literary Mama, Skirt, Sasee, moonShine review, The Press 53 Awards Anthology, Sand Hills Literary Magazine, and Idol Talk, among others. She lives in Davidson with her veterinarian husband, a cat who can open doors, and a sweet chihuahua who has played Bruiser Woods in Legally Blonde: The Musical. She treasures frequent visits with her grown daughters and their husbands.
about_summary: When late in life Beth meets Mr. Right and the granddaughter she never knew she had, she must find the courage to start all over.

title: Lest She Forget
author: Lisa Malice
author_bio: Lisa Malice earned her B.S. in psychology at the University of Minnesota, her M.S. and Ph.D. at the Georgia Institute of Technology. Her debut novel, Lest She Forget, a psychological thriller, was a finalist in five unpublished manuscript contests. Lisa is an active member of Sisters in Crime, International Thriller Writers, Mystery Writers of America, and the Authors Guild. A native of Minnesota, Lisa lived in the Atlanta area with her husband for nearly thirty years before moving to the Tampa area in 2019 to enjoy a life of sailing, fishing, and shelling on the Florida Gulf Coast. They have two adult children and a granddog.
about_summary: After a car crash, a young woman wakes from a coma with amnesia, a battered face, and no identity. Horrific nightmares convince her psychiatrist that a repressed tragedy is the source of her memory loss. She must remember her dark past before the murderer intent on finding her succeeds in wiping her memory clean—permanently.

title: Lewis Sinclair and the Gentlemen Cowboys
author: D. M. S. Fick
author_bio: D. M. S. Fick’s short fiction is published in the Nodin Press anthology, Festival of Crime. She’s also an Emmy-nominated and PromaxBDA award-winning graphic designer and cartoonist. She does design and animation for SciGirls, a PBS Kids program that encourages girls and young women to become involved in science, technology, engineering, and math. In 2015 Ms. Fick received an Artist Initiative grant from the Minnesota State Arts Board for The Oracle of Nuttown, a half-hour cartoon mash-up of forest creatures, Greek mythology, and classic 1970s movies. Ms. Fick has lived in Boston, the Twin Cities, and London. She presently resides in an old farmhouse on the Minnesota prairie with her composer husband where they sometimes observe the antics of a colorful fox family and the occasional eagle.
about_summary: A missing brooch. A face set in cement. A lovelorn musician loses his girl and his manager at a country music festival––one to betrayal, the other to murder. The festival staff and the band try to keep him off the Top Ten (suspects) List.

title: LINDEN
author: Colleen Muske
description:
Some trees grow up wanting to be tall lighthouses or big red barns full of horses. Not Linden. He is grateful just being a tree. Through snowy winters full of caroling to summertime picnics beneath his shady boughs, Linden watches over the people who love and care for him.

Colleen Muske’s heartfelt, gorgeously illustrated ode to the simple joys of loving one’s community is full of childlike wonder and comfort in the many ways nature supports and surprises us.
subtitle: The Story of a Tree
author_bio: Colleen has been drawing horses in the margins of her homework since she can remember. You will find the patterns and colors of nature throughout her paintings. Full of animals, trees, and Minnesota winters, Colleen’s stories are inspired by everyday life and her quiet, lyrical view of the world.

author_marketing_endorsers.name: Molly Beth Griffin
author_marketing_endorsers.notes: She has several picture books out – Ten Beautiful Things with Candlewick was very successful last year, and a few more on the way. She teaches writing at The Loft Literary Center and was a McKnight Foundation Literary award winner. She runs a program called Picture Book Salon (on Facebook) that meets once a month, she invited me to speak at Salon when my book comes out. Children’s book people in Minnesota and surrounding areas know her well.

author_marketing_alumni_org_publications.notes: website about connecting kids with nature, they often review picture books and have a gift guide

author_publicity_endorsers_blurbers.name: Molly Beth Griffin

She teaches writing at The Loft Literary Center and was a McKnight Foundation Literary award winner. She runs a program called Picture Book Salon (on Facebook) that meets once a month, she invited me to speak at Salon when my book comes out. Children’s book people in Minnesota and surrounding areas know her well.

author_publicity_alumni_org_publications.notes: website about connecting kids with nature, they often review picture books and have a gift guide

about_summary: Linden is a book about a tree and how he affects the lives of the community around him. The illustrations show Linden from the day he was planted in 1907 to current day. The community that lives around him enjoys all the things Linden has to offer, such as shade, a home for birds and squirrels, creative inspiration, and a place to gather. When Linden gets sick, the community comes together to help him, but nothing works. Linden is grateful he was so useful and loved by the community. When Linden is gone, it changes the way the community lives and interacts with each other. But Linden leaves a secret behind and soon everyone realizes how much Linden loved them back.
about_promotable_points: Linden is about community.
How nature can bring people together.
How important nature is in our lives.
about_diff_competitors: It’s told from the perspective of the tree.
The many ways a tree can affect the daily lives of the people and animals around it.
Linden takes place in a city and not the country or a big back yard or woods.
about_dates_holidays: Arbor day April 26, 2024- the book is scheduled to come 26th March
author_long_bio:
Colleen Muske has been practicing art her whole life. When her 6th grade teacher told her she had talent, she decided to become a real artist. She has studied at Minneapolis Community College, Minneapolis College of Art and Design, and many artists’ private studios. Colleen likes to say she is community educated since her most valuable education is from fellow artists, workshops, and conferences. 

After taking her first Children’s Book Illustration class, Colleen knew she had found her calling. Writing classes at The Loft Literary Center soon followed. Many classes and many drafts later, her stories are coming to life! Colleen’s art is full of nature, animals, and everyday life. Her favorite artists are Grandma Moses, Barbara Cooney and Henri Matisse, Colleen’s artwork is overflowing with pattern, color, and texture. 

Colleen lives in Stillwater, Minnesota with her husband in a 146-year-old house. They share their house with three dogs and two cats who inspire many of her stories.

title: Magic at the Grand Dragonfly Theatre
author: Brandie June
author_bio: Brandie June spent her childhood onstage or reading. She moved to LA to study acting at UCLA, and branched out into costume design, playwriting, and prose writing. She received her MBA in Entertainment Marketing, becoming a Marketing Director for Kids & Family entertainment. When not writing or marketing, she can be found playing with her pups, drinking too much espresso, and coming up with new art projects. Brandie lives with her husband, two spoiled rescue pups, a cat, three birds, and five bookshelves. Her debut novel, Gold Spun, is a Rumpelstiltskin retelling. Curse Undone is its sequel.
about_summary: Iris and Violet Ashmore couldn’t be less alike. While Iris shines onstage as an actress skilled in the art of sleight-of-hand tricks, Violet prefers to stay behind the scenes, where she can focus on playwriting and hiding her magical abilities from the Crown. But when a mysterious stranger arrives, they must do anything to keep their dangerous secrets from being revealed.

title: Make Mad the Guilty
author: William Norris
author_bio: William (Bill) Norris spent more than ten years working for various newspapers in England and Africa before his appointment as Parliamentary Correspondent to the prestigious Times of London. Afterward, as the Africa Correspondent for The Times, he covered a wide range of political beats in Biafra, Nigeria, Angola, the Congo, Mozambique, Botswana, Zambia, Tanzania, and Zimbabwe. He went on to counsel young journalists as the Associate Director of the PressWise Trust (a British media ethics charity) and present at colleges and conferences for many years, publishing numerous works of fiction and nonfiction inspired by his investigative journalism. He now resides in the South of France with his wife Betty, two cats, and two exhausting dogs.
about_summary: All-American Hero Jason Verne, the first man to set foot on Mars, is the perfect candidate to move into the White House, but fame and power come at a high price. When his son is kidnapped, the evolving case shows eerie parallels to one of the most heart-wrenching crimes in U.S. history, the Lindbergh kidnapping.

title: Managing the Matthews
author: Haleigh Wenger
author_bio: Haleigh Wenger is an author as well as an avid romance reader. Her debut young adult novel, The Art of Falling in Love, was published in 2019. Her most recent novel, A Feeling like Home, released in August 2021. It is the recipient of the Texas Author Project award for the same year. She is a freelance writer for a popular romance app.
about_summary: Being the talent manager for Hollywood's three hottest brothers used to be fun. Not anymore, since one of them broke her heart and another wants to ruin their friendship. When a new reality show skyrockets the brothers' popularity, Kell finds herself wondering how much, if any of the spotlight she wants.

title: Never to be Told
author: Audrey Lee
author_bio: Audrey Lee’s debut novel, The Mechanics of Memory, has received critical acclaim and was nominated for the Edgar® Award for Best First Novel, the Anthony Award for Best First Novel, and the Lefty Award for Best Debut Mystery. The audiobook was also awarded the IPPY Gold Medal for Best Mystery/Thriller. Before she started writing fiction, Audrey received her master’s degree in education from UC Berkeley (Go Bears!) and spent over two decades in public education. When she isn’t writing books she consults with school systems about creating environments for students that are more equitable, culturally responsive, and socially just. Audrey lives in the San Francisco Bay Area with her husband and Maltipoo, Luna. She spends the majority of her time missing her son, who abandoned her for college. When not doing that, Audrey is compulsively organizing, watching her son's dance videos, max betting on a slot machine, and cheering for the Golden State Warriors with a dirty martini in hand.
about_summary: Desmond Harper is haunted by his inability to remember his engagement party, a night which ended in the death of his fiancée, Ella. Even more than that, Desmond is haunted by Ella’s ghost, and she’s been asking questions about what really happened the night she died. But some truths are far worse than forgetting.

title: New Eden
author: Ruth Fox
author_bio: Ruth Fox is the author of many books, including Under the Heavens (CamCat 2022) and award-winning Monster-boy: Lair of the Grelgoroth. She has a Bachelor of Arts/Diploma of Arts in Professional Writing and Editing, and loves to read science fiction, fantasy, romance, and everything in between. She currently lives with her husband, two cats and three very adventurous sons (who also love books) in Victoria, Australia. You can find more information about her other books on her website at https://rfoxclair.wixsite.com or on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/RuthFoxAuthor.
about_summary: Kim is committed to escorting Earth’s last whales to the paradise planet of New Eden, but between juggling her newly shared Caretaker role and her budding relationship with Wren, everything is getting more difficult. To make matters worse, a rogue computer program appears to be sabotaging the Ark Project, and their new home might not actually be uninhabited.

title: None Without Sin
author: Michael Bradley
author_bio: Michael Bradley is an award-winning author from Delaware. He spent eight years as a radio DJ “on the air” before realizing he needed a real job and turned to IT. Never one to waste an experience, he used his familiarity with life on the radio for many of his suspense novels. His third novel, Dead Air (2020), won the Foreword INDIES Award as well as the IBPA Benjamin Franklin Award.
about_summary: Short Summay: When a serial killer embraces the symbolism of sin eating, a Victorian-era religious practice, a small-town journalist and a faithless minister race to uncover the motive that leads to the killer before another body drops–and their own sins are exposed.

title: One Alley Summer
author: Anne Ylvisaker
description:
The summer before middle school is a time of anxiety and change. A pitch-perfect novel in verse about one girl’s wish to simultaneously break free and to belong. 

In the summer before her first year of middle school, word-chanting, rope-skipping Phee skips her way to imagined fame, writes down her innermost secret thoughts from the safety of a treehouse, and imagines in horror that her new classmates will eat her alive. Suddenly, her well-worn alley world feels too small. So when Mercy Jones moves next door, along with Mercy’s skateboard and her don’t-mess-with-me attitude, Phee sees the chance for her universe to expand. Even if it means leaving some things behind . . . It is a time of dares, of a legendary dog named Bull, of stretching comfort zones, and of old friendships made over in new ways. And it all takes place over the course of one alley summer. 

Using pitch-perfect, richly rendered verse, Anne Ylvisaker captures the tone and insights of one girl’s wish to simultaneously break free and to belong.
subtitle: A Novel about Friendship and Growing Up

title: Our Unbreakable Thread: A Family's Love Through Generations
author: Jon Collins-Black

title: Our Vengeful Souls
author: Kristi McManus
author_bio: Kristi McManus is a registered nurse by trade, but an avid reader and enthusiastic book lover all her life. She is the author of Our Vengeful Souls, a young adult fantasy villain origin tale, as well as How to Get Over Your (Best Friend’s) Ex, a young adult rom-com. When she’s not writing, she enjoys photography, art, and considers napping to be a form of cardio. She lives in Toronto with her husband.
about_summary: A cursed mermaid seeks revenge against the brother who betrayed her while fighting to protect her secrets and her life in the realm of Atlantis.

title: Pay Attention, Oliver
author: Katherine Dwyer

shortDescription: a 32-page picture book about a young boy and his mother as they explore and discover the world around them together.

title: Penny Preston and the King's Blade
author: Armen Pogharian
author_bio:
Unlike many authors, Armen Pogharian was not an early reader. He can honestly say he didn’t voluntarily read a book until he finished The Hobbit in sixth grade. He earned a BS in Electrical Engineering from Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute, where he was an Honorable-Mention All-American swimmer. As a USAF officer he worked on classified ‘Area 51’ projects—he never saw a single alien (dead or alive). He later earned an MBA from the University of North Carolina in Chapel Hill and spent more than a decade in the high tech and biotech industries.

Armen’s stories mix elements of science and history with a healthy dose of fantasy. When not writing, he enjoys swimming, playing ukulele (no public recordings exist), and the outdoors. He lives outside Rochester, NY with his wife and family.
about_summary: Attacks against the multiverse threaten a cosmic crunch. Re-energized Bodach unleash havoc: an ancient commander seeking revenge for her defeat by the King’s Blade, an ethereal Celtic spirit with a taste for exotic nuclear particles, and a shape-shifting spy. Who can Penny trust when one wrong step destroys everything?

title: Penny Preston and the Raven's Talisman
author: Armen Pogharian
author_bio:
Unlike many authors, Armen Pogharian was not an early reader. He can honestly say he didn’t voluntarily read a book until he finished The Hobbit in sixth grade. He earned a BS in Electrical Engineering from Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute, where he was an Honorable-Mention All-American swimmer. As a USAF officer he worked on classified ‘Area 51’ projects—he never saw a single alien (dead or alive). He later earned an MBA from the University of North Carolina in Chapel Hill and spent more than a decade in the high tech and biotech industries.

Armen’s stories mix elements of science and history with a healthy dose of fantasy. When not writing, he enjoys swimming, playing ukulele (no public recordings exist), and the outdoors. He lives outside Rochester, NY with his wife and family.
about_summary: Eighth-grader Penny opens a dimensional rift causing a food fight. Instead of being suspended, she learns she is misaligned. She exists in more than 3-dimensions. With her multi-dimensional cat and best friend Duncan, Penny fights to save our universe from higher-dimensional invaders and uncover her connection to Arthurian myth.

title: Penny Preston and the Silver Scepter
author: Armen Pogharian
author_bio:
Unlike many authors, Armen Pogharian was not an early reader. He can honestly say he didn’t voluntarily read a book until he finished The Hobbit in sixth grade. He earned a BS in Electrical Engineering from Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute, where he was an Honorable-Mention All-American swimmer. As a USAF officer he worked on classified ‘Area 51’ projects—he never saw a single alien (dead or alive). He later earned an MBA from the University of North Carolina in Chapel Hill and spent more than a decade in the high tech and biotech industries.

Armen’s stories mix elements of science and history with a healthy dose of fantasy. When not writing, he enjoys swimming, playing ukulele (no public recordings exist), and the outdoors. He lives outside Rochester, NY with his wife and family.
about_summary: Eighth grader Penny Preston is different indeed. A misaligned teen who can untie knots of time, Penny must ward off two time travelers before they steal the scepter to reset time and change history.

title: Phantom
author: Helen Power
author_bio: Helen Power is obsessed with ghosts. She spends her free time watching paranormal investigation TV shows, hanging out in cemeteries, and telling anyone who’ll listen about her paranormal experiences. She is a librarian living in Saskatoon, Canada, and has several short story publications, including ones in Suspense Magazine and Dark Helix Press’s Canada 150 anthology, “Futuristic Canada”. The Ghosts of Thorwald Place is her first novel.
about_summary: A broke and desperate woman sold her hand for quick cash and is now racked with insufferable phantom limb pain. After enlisting in an experimental drug trial, she develops a psychic connection to her missing limb that is being used . . . to kill.

title: Queen's Catacombs
author: Jordan H. Bartlett
author_bio: Jordan H. Bartlett is an award-winning, New Zealand-born Canadian author with a love for children’s literature and female empowerment. She grew up reading books about boys for boys and found it hard to find a strong heroine she could relate to. Bartlett wrote the Frean Chronicles to give young readers that character she so longed for in a world where gender norms are reversed. Bartlett currently resides in Banff, Alberta where she works as a speech language pathologist and is a certified yoga instructor.
about_summary: Jacs is now Queen of Frea, but it comes with many challenges that she had not anticipated when those close to her are captured and used as leverage against the new Queen. In her search for answers, Jacs uncovers a much darker truth from the Queendom’s past that will forever change its future.

title: Queendom Come
author: Jordan H. Bartlett
author_bio: Jordan H. Bartlett is an award-winning, New Zealand-born Canadian author with a love for children’s literature and female empowerment. She grew up reading books about boys for boys and found it hard to find a strong heroine she could relate to. Bartlett wrote the Frean Chronicles to give young readers that character she so longed for in a world where gender norms are reversed. Bartlett currently resides in Banff, Alberta where she works as a speech language pathologist and is a certified yoga instructor.
about_summary: In the final book in the Frean Chronicles, Jacs, Queen of Frea, struggles to stay afloat beneath the weight of her crown as she prepares to face her enemies before they can tear her Queendom apart.

title: Rafa and the Wrong Legs
author: Angie Lucas
description:
Rafael is finally old enough to visit the supermarket without having to ride in the shopping cart. He promises Mama he will stay by her side, and for a while, he does . . . especially when tasting samples from the Cookie Man. But after a bouncing berry lures him away, Rafa wanders into a sea of unfamiliar legs. Will he ever find his way back to Mama? 

Rafa and the Wrong Legs is a sweet, clever, and wise story that every parent and curious child will recognize as their own. A special Q&A at the end contains expert advice about what to do should your own little Rafa ramble off in a public place.
author_bio: Angie Lucas is a children’s book writer who used to edit magazines, compose ad copy, and ghostwrite for tech CEOs. Now she writes little stories about big, embarrassing elephants; big, dumb, invisible dragons; and little boys who get lost in grocery stores. She firmly believes that sunlight is the best antidote to shame—and that it takes time, attention, and compassionate connection to tame an unruly elephant. A graduate of Utah State University, Angie lives with her precious patchwork family (she has one child through marriage, one through adoption, and one through birth), near Salt Lake City.
illustrator_bio: Ana Sanfelippo is an artist and graphic designer from Buenos Aires, Argentina. She is the illustrator of the IBBY-honored Perfect Project: A Book about Autism, selected as an “Outstanding Book for Young People with Disabilities.” Among other accolades, her illustrated collection of pottery received a “Good Design Seal” from Buenos Aires’ Metropolitan Design Center. Her vibrant art combines many by-hand techniques and has exhibited in Argentina, Slovakia, England, Canada, and Spain. Find her at anasanfelippo.com

about_summary: Rafa and the Wrong Legs: Little Rafa has lost his mother. One minute, he’s clinging to her calf while she picks out produce. The next, a bouncing berry leads him astray, and he finds himself tugging on a complete stranger’s trousers! Mortified, Rafa runs deeper into the unfamiliar grocery aisles. With so many different kinds of legs wandering past, how will Rafa ever find his way back to Mama? Rafa’s story will spark important conversations between parents and preschoolers about what to do (and what not to do) if they ever get lost in a public place, with helpful tips and a discussion guide included in the back matter.
about_promotable_points: Safety. This story is a fun and accessible way to teach kids about the importance of staying near caregivers when out in public, with tips about what to do if they ever get lost.
Humor.

Food vocabulary. This story mentions lots of familiar and less common produce items to help pique kids’ interest in different kinds of healthful foods, including artichokes, honeydew, pistachios, etc.
about_bookstore_shelf: Picture books   Social-Emotional Learning titles   Mental health
about_diff_competitors: The story is not overly instructive or didactic. It’s a fun and engaging story with subtle lessons that can be teased out.
The back matter has practical, memorable, and useful tips to help parents and teachers teach children how to keep themselves safe if they ever get lost.
This is an important safety topic, but it’s written in a way that will not be scary or anxiety inducing, which will put kids in a better frame of mind to absorb its lessons.

February 22: Supermarket Employee Day 
March 18: Awkward Moments Day

December 9: Official Lost and Found Day
author_long_bio:
Angie Lucas used to edit magazines, compose ad copy, and ghostwrite articles for tech CEOs. Now she writes little stories about big childhood challenges. Through picture books about grief and loss, embarrassing family secrets, and getting lost in a grocery store, she hopes to spark essential conversations between kids and their caregivers. A lifelong language lover and unapologetic word nerd, Angie also loves yoga, freshly sharpened pencils, fresh mountain air, and volunteering in her faith community. The mother of one child through marriage, one through adoption, and one through birth, Angie lives with her precious patchwork family near Salt Lake City, Utah.

Present professional position:  

Children’s author and freelance writer 

 

Former positions:  

- Freelance content marketer and ghost writer (clients included Workfront, Ragnar, FamilySearch, Persado) 
- Editorial director, Big Picture Classes (online classes for crafters and memory keepers) 
- Co-owner, Ella Publishing Company (ebook publisher catering to crafters and memory keepers) 
- Managing editor, Simple Scrapbooks Magazine  
- Advertising copywriter, Studeo 
- Online copywriter, FranklinCovey 
- Managing editor, Utah Homebuilder Magazine (McGraw-Hill) 
- Copyeditor, FranklinCovey

title: Revisionist Future
author: Lee Bumbicka
author_bio:
Lee Bumbicka is the child of a US Army officer and an English war bride. He started writing when he was a teenager but became a serious author in 1997. He is an Aerospace engineer, graduating from the University of Missouri, Rolla. He has a wife and two children, along with one sister who also writes.

When he is not writing, Lee builds (and collects) vintage model kits, and watches baseball, football and Hockey. He has also been seen playing golf and tennis. On his long walks he contemplates new stories to tell. His goal is to make the reader think, I didn’t see that coming.
about_summary: Suffering from writer’s block, Michael Schatten books himself into a remote beachside cabin to find inspiration. In an antique shop in the nearby town, he stumbles upon a quaint typewriter, and begins to type a short story. While it is every writer’s dream to write characters that come to life, Michael Schatten wakes up in a nightmare.

title: Ricochet
author: Kellyn Carni
author_bio: Kellyn Carni lives in the mountains near Asheville, North Carolina with her husband, baby boy, dog, cat, and chickens. When she isn’t cuddling one of the aforementioned (usually not the chickens) under a blanket with a good book, she enjoys camping, yoga, and live music. She works as a physical therapist assistant and holds a degree in International Politics. While Kellyn has been writing since childhood, Ricochet is her debut novel.
about_summary: Anastasia Romanov and her younger brother Alexei escape their family’s execution when a bullet strikes Anastasia’s necklace, transporting them to a parallel universe. Anastasia must save the Romanovs of this world before they meet the same fate as her own family.

title: Sanctuary
author: Valentina Cano Repetto
author_bio: Born in Uruguay to Italian and Latino parents and having lived in Miami, FL, for twenty-three years, Valentina has now made her home in a secluded Victorian watermill in Italy, which was the direct inspiration for this novel. Her debut novel, The Rose Master (2014 REUTS Publications, LLC) was called “a strong, satisfying effort” by Publishers Weekly, and her latest novel, Aleister Blake (Journal Stone’s Trepidatio Publishing), was published in September 2022. Valentina also runs a blog, Il Vecchio Mulino delle Rocche, where she shares her journey restoring the mill and home.
about_summary: In 1930s Italy, a woman must battle sinister forces threatening her life and sanity when she and her husband move into an abandoned, run-down, and isolated watermill.

title: Shadows Over London
author: Christian Klaver
author_bio: Christian Klaver has been writing for over twenty years, with a number of magazine publications, including Escape Pod, Dark Wisdom Anthology, and Anti-Matter. He’s the author of The Supernatural Case Files of Sherlock Holmes series, but has written over a dozen novels, both fantasy and sci-fi, often with a Noir bent. He's worked as book-seller, bartender and a martial-arts instructor before settling into a career in internet security. He lives just outside the sprawling decay of Detroit, Michigan, with his wife, Kimberly, his daughter, Kathryn, and a group of animals he refers to as The Menagerie. He’s also a part of the Untitled Writer’s Group based in Ann Arbor for the past decade or so with a bunch of equally starry-eyed dreamers and social misanthropes.
about_summary: Justice Kasric and her siblings are forced to choose sides between their mother and father after a Faerie invasion throws them out of their comfortable life in London and they begin manifesting magical abilities their parents hid from them before the war.

title: Snowbird
author: William Norris
author_bio: William (Bill) Norris spent more than ten years working for various newspapers in England and Africa before his appointment as Parliamentary Correspondent to the prestigious Times of London. Afterward, as the Africa Correspondent for The Times, he covered a wide range of political beats in Biafra, Nigeria, Angola, the Congo, Mozambique, Botswana, Zambia, Tanzania, and Zimbabwe. He went on to counsel young journalists as the Associate Director of the PressWise Trust (a British media ethics charity) and present at colleges and conferences for many years, publishing numerous works of fiction and nonfiction inspired by his investigative journalism. He now resides in the South of France with his wife Betty, two cats, and two exhausting dogs.
about_summary: Andrew Richard Barnes survived crashes and gunfire, treachery and betrayal to fly the very first shipments of cocaine for the Medellín Cartel into the United States. In Snowbird, investigative journalist William Norris sits down with Barnes himself to recount the crimes and dangers that riddled his drug-smuggling flights throughout the 1970s and ’80s.

title: So You Had To Build A Time Machine
author: Jason Offutt
author_bio: Jason Offutt writes books. This is infinitely better than what his father trained him to do, which was to drink beer and shout at the television. He is best known for science fiction, such as his end-of-the-world zombie novel Bad Day for the Apocalypse (a curious work that doesn’t include zombies), his paranormal non-fiction like Chasing American Monsters (that does), and his book of humor How to Kill Monsters Using Common Household Objects. He teaches university journalism, cooks for his family, and wastes much of his writing time trying to keep the cat off his lap. You can find more about Jason at his website, www.jasonoffutt.com. There are no pictures of his cat Gary, and it serves him right.
about_summary: Circus runaway Skid meets a theoretical physicist named Dave in a bar and punches him in the nose. When Dave disappears before he hits the floor, Skid finds herself caught up in his dimension-hopping race to shut down a time machine gone rogue. Good thing Skid knows how to finish a fight, because Dave sure doesn’t.

title: Son of the Salt Chaser
author: A. S. Thornton
author_bio: A. S. Thornton has evolved from book blogger to author with a particular fondness for writing forbidden love in ancient deserts. She lives in Northern California, where she works as a veterinarian. Learn more about her on IG @as_thornton and visit her website asthornton.com.
about_summary: After freeing Saalim, Emel realizes he is even more out of her reach. Saalim is king of Madinat Almulihi and has no recollection of Emel. Using her newfound freedom from the Salt King, Emel follows Saalim to Madinat Almulihi to get back what she lost—him. But their pasts lurk close behind and carry with them dark secrets.

title: Sophie
author: Brian Anderson
description:
A JLG Gold Standard selection  

Praised as “reminiscent of Calvin and Hobbes” by Kirkus Reviews, and “the perfect mix of heart, humor, and hilarity” by Big Nate creator Lincoln Peirce, this comic strip-turned-graphic-novel series hits the sweet spot for both kids and any pet-obsessed grownups. 

Wags to Wishes, Book 3 of this middle-grade graphic novel series starring Sophie the chocolate lab, pokes gently at family power structures. Still reeling from all the new additions to her family (a human baby along with various stray dogs and cats), Sophie decides that – as the alpha – it is up to her to protect them all. And so she tries . . . from an island of temptation made entirely of desserts, to an army of discarded chew toys seeking revenge for lost squeakers, to the cats’ unending pursuit to rule humanity, Sophie’s adventures are epic, fun, and funny.

author_bio: Brian Anderson is the author of The Conjurers trilogy. He is also an optioned screenwriter and the creator of the syndicated comic strip “Dog Eat Doug.” He lives in North Carolina with his family, which includes a herd of rescued dogs and cats.

about_promotable_points: Family friendly
Humor for young and old readers
about_diff_competitors: Dog eat Doug has a proven track record of appealing to readers of all ages. Grandparents read it to their grandkids, parents share it with their kids.
Dog eat Doug, much like Pixar films, is known for multi-layered humor to entertain audiences of all ages.
Kids and adults relate to it because it reflects their own lives. I constantly get accused of hiding cameras in my readers’ homes.
about_audience: Kids ages 4-12 will be the majority of the audience. But these are characters a lot of people fell in love with when they were young and some have kids of their own now. My goal is to make these books families will read together.
about_dates_holidays: There is a giant demand for family friendly entertainment as evidenced by the continuing popularity of Peanuts and Calvin and Hobbes. While Dog eat Doug shared newspaper space with both of those comics, it is uniquely positioned to expand beyond the limited four panel world.

title: Space Holes
author: B. R. Louis
author_bio: B. R. Louis is a pediatric critical care nurse, outdoor enthusiast, and tech nerd with a love for storytelling, writing, and making people laugh. Travels around the world have introduced him to different cultures and unique forms of storytelling. Through all of the exploration and time spent in countless discussions, he's found the one innate thing that ties all people together is our ability and desire to share laughter.
about_summary: Thrown aboard humanity’s first intergalactic commerce vessel, untrained tag-along Marcus Aimond and his crew encounter an alien civilization dead-locked in civil war. Equipped with grit, knee pads, and a mediocre ability to play the saxophone, Aimond and the crew must find a way to broker peace for the sake of positive corporate sales initiatives.

title: Summer People
author: Sara Hosey
author_bio: Sara Hosey is the author of the novel Iphigenia Murphy and the novella Great Expectations, as well as short fiction that has appeared in publications including Cordella Magazine and Casino Literary. Sara has also written an academic book about popular culture, titled Home Is Where the Hurt Is: Media Depictions of Wives and Mothers. Along with being a writer, she has worn many hats. But these days, she teaches English at a community college. When she’s not working, she likes to spend time with her family and pets in her home in upstate New York.
about_summary: Though Christmas Miller planned to spend the summer before college waterskiing and sunbathing with her best friend Lexi, everything changes when the girls discover a body floating face down in Sweet Lake. Christmas must face the fact that all is not as it seems in her beloved community.

title: Sunset Tomorrow
author: E. Ervin Tibbs
author_bio:
E. Ervin Tibbs was born into a family of migrant farm workers, camped under a fig tree in central California. It was 1939, the tail end of the Great Depression, and many still suffered its aftermath. In Europe, the dogs of war were straining at their leashes, but in the U.S., penny candy actually cost a penny.

Throughout his lifetime, Ervin has survived by being flexible. He has picked cotton, built boats, worked as a roustabout, served as a hitch in the U.S. Army Intelligence, and the list could go on much longer.

Ervin’s writing has been nominated for many awards. His short story “Winter Falcon” was the runner-up in the 1992 St. Martin’s Press Best New Detective contest. Another of his short stories, “The Shaman’s Apprentice,” was a finalist in the 2002 Time Warner Best Fantasy Contest.

He is now a retired chemist and spends his days building custom guitars and writing.
about_summary: Jude and his misfit friends are penniless, jobless, and spend their days bartering for booze. They have been friends for years but don’t know much about each other. Until they go on a twenty-four hour quest to fulfill the wish of a sick child. If they succeed before sunset tomorrow, their lives could change forever.

title: Temple of Conquest
author: Mark Broe
about_summary: As a thriving, young rock climber, Telep worked hard and was committed to his community’s pursuit of progress. But after a climbing accident, Telep’s loved ones are sent away. He sets off on a journey to find his friends but ends up finding much more. With each setting sun, he begins to see a new destiny for himself.

title: The Adventures of Penguin and Panda
author: Brenda Maier
description:
Penguin and Panda should not be friends. The very idea is absurd. Penguin likes to build things and Panda likes to nap. Panda munches bamboo and Penguin gobbles cheese puffs and jam-banana sandwiches. Penguin never powers down and Panda has a hard time powering up. There is no way their friendship would ever work. Except somehow, it does.

In the tradition of Narwal and Jelly, here is an extremely commercial illustrated chapter book/graphic novel series for young readers. Bright, kid-friendly illustrations are full of humor. An odd couple buddy comedy featuring two buddies who clearly love each other. The author is an elementary school teacher, so she knows the voices, the audience, and she knows what teachers look for in books like these. 

Simple dialogue belies the depth of Penguin’s and Panda’s conversations; dig deep and you’ll find hints of moral philosophy—just like in Winnie the Pooh.

At $9.99 for 4 complete stories, plus a few kid-friendly extras, the package is a bargain. Five-book commitment from the outset, with the first two titles debuting simultaneously so kids won’t have to wait for another, and so booksellers know we’re serious in our support for this series.
subtitle: Fun and Games

After graduating university as a product design engineer, she pivoted to art school and set out to illustrate books for young readers. The Penguin and Panda books mark her U.S. debut. Fanni and her husband are the parents of one daughter; they all enjoy reading and watching cartoons together.

If my publisher sends me to ALA, I’ll be in San Diego for part of that. It’s June 27-July 2, 2024 in total.

about_summary: Penguin and Panda should not be friends. The very idea is absurd. Penguin likes to build things and Panda likes to nap. Panda munches bamboo and Penguin gobbles cheese puffs and jam-banana sandwiches. Penguin never powers down and Panda has a hard time powering up. There is no way their friendship would ever work. Except somehow, it does.
about_promotable_points: It’s got two best friends who are polar opposites, but they can still be friends.
The characters’ experiences mirror those of children’s. Kids struggle with emotions like frustration, guilt, and anger just like Penguin and Panda do.
They’re positive. Even if someone makes a mistake, the stories center on hope, positivity, and kindness.
about_bookstore_shelf: In the early graphic chapter book section, or wherever Narwhal & Jelly is.
about_diff_competitors: Penguin & Panda focuses on very authentic, relatable, child-mirroring situations.
There’s a bit of wisdom in each book. There’s a sort of generalized bit of knowledge or philosophy in each one.
Though the characters struggle with various things, they are kind and empathetic, always with a happy ending. You can count on them.
about_audience: Elementary school-aged kids from 5-10, depending on their ability to read. I don’t see this as a read-aloud that teachers will do, but we might be able to market them for reading groups with questions to download. And of course they’re super engaging for classroom libraries and kids shopping with their parents.
author_long_bio: Brenda Maier is a writer, mother of five, public school teacher, and board member of OAGCT, the Oklahoma affiliate of the National Association for Gifted Children. Among her books for young readers are The Little Red Fort and The Little Blue Bridge, both of which have been named to notable reading lists. She lives in Oklahoma with her family and enjoys visiting classrooms around the country to share her passion for reading, writing, and goal-setting. Her hobbies include tricking kids into thinking for themselves, reading way past her bedtime, and dragging her husband and kids to places they’ve never been, whether they want to go or not. You can visit her at brendamaier.com

title: The Adventures of Penguin and Panda
author: Brenda Maier
description:
Beloved odd-couple Penguin and Panda return in four new adventures. Whether it’s Penguin’s first campout (in the dark!) or her strange competition with the new neighbor, she is definitely feeling all the feels. Panda, Mr. Low-Key, is always happy to offer up sage wisdom, but his inability to stop putting things off comes back to bite him when he ruins a special Fun Friday. 

Penned by a gifted-education specialist, and full of hilarious illustrations and a generous spirit of friendship, In the Dark is perfect for early readers. If you’ve enjoyed Narwhal and Jelly, give this funny duo a try.
subtitle: In the Dark
series: The Adventures of Penguin and Panda
table_of_contents:
1. Just Pick One
2. The Contest
3. Later
4. In the Dark
